column4: Breakingviews: Goldman left with long-term greedy as only option
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Goldman Sachs  executives would in past years boast of being long-term greedy: They would rather wait for riches than make a quick buck. They may no longer have a choice.

column4: Roboadvisers set to capitalize under new U.S. retirement plan rule
column5: NEW YORK A new U.S. rule protecting retirement funds from commission-paid brokers could be good for roboadvisers  a fast-growing sector that manages money with algorithms who may collect new clients fired by other firms because their accounts are too small.
